Description of Demand / Problem

90 Day Notice - EPP Status Field Standardisation  
Date: Tuesday 2nd March 2021
Additional Information: .UK Status Field Standardisation
 
What is changing?
 
Responses of INFO and UPDATE EPP commands will be updated to implement the EPP status fields contained in the following EPP RFCs:
RFC5731: Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) Domain Name Mapping
RFC5732: Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) Host Mapping
RFC5733: Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) Contact Mapping
 
For details of the changes to these responses, please visit Registrar Resources.
 
Why are we making these changes?
 
Based on your feedback, and a recognition that standardisation is a positive change (providing that it preserves online standards for all while enhancing registrars' and registrants' user experiences), we intend to introduce EPP status fields to the .UK registry.
 
What action do I need to take?
 
It is important that you ensure your systems are set up and ready to process these new responses by 1st March 2021. Registrar Resources provides a detailed breakdown of changes to functionality along with samples of the new status fields in EPP responses.
 
We will be deploying to the .UK Testbed environment on Tuesday 2nd February 2021 to give you plenty of time to try out this new functionality ahead of the launch date. The Testbed will be configured to allow you to test all functionality
 
Further Support
 
Registrar documentation for .UK EPP commands are available on Registrar Resources.|
